The park is crossed in the east-west direction by a pedestrian path, and right in the centre of the park the old vestiges of what it used to be a train station crosses the path perpendicularly.

keep-walking-to-the.text:
On your way to the S-bahn you arrive at Oberbaumbrucke.

Sometimes you think this is the most beautiful bridge in all Berlin, probably in the world. Under it crosses a wide stream of the Spree and from here looking into the west you can easily spot the famous TV Tower, surrounded by big buildings and in composition with the river, seemingly directed to the tower. Looking to the east you can admire the other component of Berlin, that is, the green areas, the constant flow of water, and in general the mixture of nature in a urban landscape.

The bridge itself is beautiful, constituted by red stones with two big gothic towers and heraldic figures at the top. Below the towers there are two decks for the bridge, to top one with a railway for the U-bahn and the bottom one for pedestrians and motor vehicles. On the walls of the building supporting the top deck there is a depiction of some medieval looking coats of arms.

It is common to find live music being played on the bridge.

While admiring the Spree you realise you are not alone, there is a big guy wearing an oversized coat with a blue and black tartan, the guy is wearing black horn rimmed glasses and seems deeply concentrated on his own thoughts.

Monday night, Home.

You arrive to your flat finally, after such a long day.

The apartment is a bit cold as you live on your own and no one was here to turn the heating.

It is a cosy apartment, perhaps small, but you don't need anything bigger for yourself. It is overlooking the canal and you feel privileged for having a good view of it and for being very close to the water.

You don't own too much furniture, when moving in you decided to have just the essential to be comfortable; perhaps you should do the cleaning more often, can't remember if last time you mopped the floor was last week or the week before that.

As an after thought you remember there is still a piece of that delicious cheese cake in the fridge, and as soon as you cross by the living room you get a glance of "Notes on the synthesis of form", by Christopher Alexander, the book you were reading during the weekend and didn't finish it yet.

You take the longer route and decide to go through the Soviet War Memorial.

It is a breathtaking place, even more at night. Is not easy to have a huge green place right into the city like this, completely surrounded by big trees, it seems almost like the closes urban area is kilometres away. There is no sound coming from any direction at all, also the lack of proper artificial illumination makes this place even more mysterious and gloomy.

But is not only the darkness and the trees that make this place beautiful, you stop for a moment to admire the memorial, those impressive soldiers kneeling and guarding the entrance, and the huge soldier at the top of the memorial wielding and also huge sword and protecting a little girl, resemble a knight from fairy tales and giving the place a whole atmosphere of fantasy.

This is even more accentuated by the velvetish blue moon light covering the area.

While admiring the memorial you realise you are not alone, somebody else is also admiring it, seems like a big person, considerable taller than you wearing a long coat, he is probably 30 metres away.

You realise that in fact this can be a good place for living, people can have anything they need and the surroundings are good enough, they have the river close by and the central station too. olgas-weekend.text: Olga: I stayed at home and advanced with some of the work, which was fine because today has been a stressful. We got this new project a few hours ago but it should have been finished yesterday, as always.

options.text: (Time is running, let's head to the S-bahn now)
Wonderful river isn't it? (While walking away)

approach-the-guy-admiring.text: As you get closer to the guy you realise he doesn't even notice you, he is totally lost in his thoughts. Maybe is better to leave him alone.

options.text: (Knock on the door)
Ahem
(Wait for him to notice you)
Hey

william-office.text:
William's office is the buzz of the building, there is never a dull moment in here. It seems that Mr Playfair does not stop, rest or take a break, not even for lunch.

He seems concentrated deeply reading a document.

options.text: I'm glad to know that we are together on this
Seems to me that you are jealous that I got this project and not you
We better finish this soon, I don't like it
I'm going to be able to learn a lot with you by my side

stepping-out-of-william.text:
Stepping out of William's office Olga approaches you once more.

Olga: So, aren't you excited about this new project?

options.text: (Approach the small boy)
(This is too much, maybe let's head back and take the U-bahn instead)
(It is a tough world, let's keep walking)
(It is better if I just walk fast)

try-to-find-cover.text:
As you cover yourself behind a tree you can observe how the small boy gets removed from some of his belongings, including his jacket, sneakers and wallet, while getting beaten by the big guys.

A few moments later, with the boy laying on the ground, the big guys decided to leave. It takes a couple of minutes for the small boy to get on his feet.

options.text: (Nobody will notice, let's just forget it for now)
(Maybe I should stop buying tickets at all)
(Buy a new ticket)

the-s-bahn-at.text:
The S-bahn at Warchauer Strasse is packed as usual. With the local folklore perceptible at every corner, from the indie musicians playing on the street, the illegal dealings in the entrance, to the beggars drinking on the stairs of the station.

While waiting for the train you remember that your monthly ticket for public transport just expired. A new one costs 82 euros.

Should you get a new one?

options.text: (Just walk the usual route)
(I always prefer walking along the green areas, let's do that)

walk-back-home.text:
It is a beautiful night indeed. The moon is not full yet but it is bright enough, there are a few clouds scattered around but they don't seem to be bothering the moon at all.

Should you take the regular route or now that you are in the feeling of walking you should take the longer but most beautiful route, crossing through the green areas?

options.text: (Run, now!)
(Genuflect and try to be forgiven)
Now is your time to get away while you still can!
Do you want me to decorate your face, punk?! (While moving the pipe on your hands)

throw-your-backpack-to.text:
Impressively enough your backpack lands right on the face of the big guy in left throwing him to the ground. In the meantime you were able to find a metal pipe laying close by. You took the pipe in one hand and adopt a defensive position with it.

Big guy right: Who do you think you are?

options.text: (Anyway is better than walking, just keep waiting and board the train)
(Should have walked instead, anyway too late for that, wait and board the train as it comes)
(Wish I could at least wait while eating a cake, board the train as soon as it comes)

the-u-bahn-gorlitzer.text:
The U-bahn at Gorlitzer Bahnhof is not so crowded today, maybe because of the hour, still early for rush hour.

Your train seems to be a little bit delayed.

options.text: (This is too creepy, let's just go home)
(Try to get closer to the guy and try to start a conversation)

approach-the-person.text:
As you get closer you realise it is a man and seems to be nervous by your approach.

He is really wearing a big oversized coat, with somewhat resembling a blue and black tartan on it. He is wearing horn rimmed glasses.

Maybe you can try to approach him but it doesn't look like he is up for conversation.

options.text: Why did you want to see me?
Thank you, I appreciate your support
Work just keeps coming and coming, is it going to be like this forever?
I like how things are going, working hard and learning fast

please-sit.text:
William: Oh thanks for coming, please take a seat.

William: Tell me how are things going, you know you can always come to my office if you need help with anything.

options.text: Busy day
Do you want a coffee?
I'm fine, just warming up on Monday morning

another-coffee.text:
A third coffee in the morning seems like stressing it too much, but then again it has been a busy morning so far.

While operating the espresso machine Olga approaches you.

Olga: Good to see you, how are you doing?

options.text: (This was not so smart, let's not do it again)
(Life is a risk)
(I learned my lesson)

not-so-smart.text:
After a few minutes the train arrives, as expected it is packet too and there seems to be no place to sit.

To make matters worst, while the train it is already on its way a woman steps up from her seat, brandishing a badge that identifies her as ticket inspector...

After an embarrassing scene where the inspector asked you to leave the train with her in the next station and you had to pay a 40 euro fine for not carrying a ticket with yourself you are back again in the next train, this time not without first stopping to buy a new monthly ticket, of course you won't be happy if this happens twice in the same day right?

options.text: Just tell me the short version of this
I think I have gone myself to that store
I agree, it is a nice location
Is this leading to something at all?

well-there-is.text: William: Well, there is an Aldo's Supermarket just 600 metres from the station. A very good location actually, just outside of the main railway station, in a very central area of the city and highly commercial neighbourhood too...

options.text: (Keep walking to the S-banh)
(Too much excitement for one day, let's go back and take the U-bahn)
(Walk as fast as possible now)

i-am-glad-you.text:
Small boy: My name is Tim, I will not forget this, thanks again.

You can sense the gratitude coming from the small boy as he leaves.

options.text: (Let's just go home)
(Go and see how is Olga doing)

go-to-see-william.text: William seems really busy corroborating some designs and blueprints, maybe you should not disturb him.
